candidates.name: Alexandra Bonham
candidates.why_elect: I know Auckland well. I was a walking tour guide here and this led me to study the role of play in Auckland's urban ecology for my PhD. My research covers law, urban planning, innovation, play, psychology, the arts. I'm really interested, I care and I'm hard-working, friendly, and quick..
candidates.why_stand: I was asked by a women I deeply respect to consider doing so. I have long been an advocate for children and youth to have access to play. As the city evolves I feel strongly that we need to set aside space for nature, for people, for quality of life.

candidates.name: Tadhg Tim Stopford
candidates.why_elect: I'm a kiwi. Luckily I've been able to see the world too, and I'm a big reader. So, I reckon I have a good idea about some of the things we are doing well, not so well, and not at all. My professional networks are wide, and my ethics good.
candidates.why_stand: We, and our kids, face trouble in housing, economy, climate, food security, job security, world peace even. I'd like to help us move beyond tinkering at the edges to actually changing the models which are causing us grief. "We don't have money, so we have to think"—Lord Rutherford.

candidates.name: Glenda Fryer
candidates.why_elect: I served as an Auckland City Councillor for nine years including Chair of its Planning Committee, am a current Local Board member, leading in Parks and local economic development. I listen and know how to get things done. I'll call CCOs to account in the complex system of Auckland Council.
candidates.why_stand: I feel blessed to live in Waitemata. We have a duty to improve our environment and nurture our community. I will give my heart and vision to grasp and tackle the huge issues of population growth, housing, transport, and climate change. I'll work hard creating an inclusive and caring community.

candidates.name: Graeme Gunthorp
candidates.why_elect: I'm enthusiastic and excited, as well as experienced enough to deliver on my promises. I have great management experience, understand how to run complex operations, and will always listen to the community for new ideas.
candidates.why_stand: I love seeing cities work efficiently, and I see so many opportunities to make Auckland the most liveable, enjoyable and incredible city in the world. I'll focus on the transport network, public spaces, events and utilities, and I will give everything I have to make it happen.

candidates.name: Allan Matson
candidates.why_elect: I've spent years trying to protect heritage buildings, and I think there is a need amongst those elected for greater understanding of the built environment. Having been on various elected bodies before, I am familiar with getting items on agendas, gathering the necessary information and helping to make informed decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I don't want Auckland's future growth to be characterised by ugly development, and so I'm running because I think an elected position would provide the opportunity to bring a greater sensibility to issues around the built environment, in particular the retention of some of the city's architectural heritage and character.

candidates.name: Will Maxwell-Steele
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in the Waitemata Local Board area for almost all of my adult life. I have seen far too much waste and poor planning. Being self employed, I know the value of a dollar and will question things that don't seem right.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Auckland is an amazing city and that we need to keep it that way.

candidates.name: Keith Mcconnell
candidates.why_elect: Three reasons. I will ask the difficult questions and keep asking them until I get a satisfactory answer. I have no allegiances to either a party or special causes so can judge issues on their merits. I am prepared to speak out on things that aren't working.
candidates.why_stand: I want to make a difference by using my time, skills and experience to significantly improve the standard of the services provided to residents and businesses by Council and Auckland Transport so that our area retains its standing as a top class area to work and live.

candidates.name: Richard Northey
candidates.why_elect: I have years of experience and achievement of being an effective elected representative and of chairing successful community organisations such as the Auckland Community Housing Trust, the Problem Gambling Foundation and the Auckland District Council of Social Services.
candidates.why_stand: I want to do what I can to accomplish policies and services for a higher quality of life and greater fairness and opportunity for all Aucklanders.

candidates.name: Julie Sandilands
candidates.why_elect: I am practical, passionate and love my community. I am a local business owner, a writer and a sustainability expert, with qualifications in engineering, business and science. I am committed to great outcomes for Waitematā.
candidates.why_stand: I want everyone to get the best out of Waitematā.
